original: @144b / /bod skad du /
analyzed: @144b / /bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: zas kyis 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: zas kyis 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: The MahƒÅyƒÅna S≈´tra Called The Purity of Nourishment

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /üîΩbcom ldan 'das 'od ma'i tshal na dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po brgya phrag @145a *//
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na / bcom ldan 'das 'od ma'i tshal na dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po brgya phrag @145a *//
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: phyed dang bcu gsum dang / gzhan yang dge slong pha dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen pha dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / lha klu sde brgyad dang / byang chub sems dpa' mang po dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs so //
analyzed: phyed dang bcu gsum dang / gzhan yang dge slong pha dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen pha dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / lha klu sde brgyad dang / byang chub sems dpa' mang po dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in the Bamboo Grove with a great sa·πÖgha of one thousand two hundred and fifty monks, and also with many other monks, nuns, male and female lay followers, the eight classes of gods and spirits, and bodhisattvas.

original: de nas moonggal gyi bu chen po 'dug pa las langs te /
analyzed: de nas moonggal gyi bu chen po 'dug pa las langs te /
translated: Then MahƒÅmaudgalyƒÅyana rose from his seat

original: bcom ldan 'das la phyag btsal te 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la phyag btsal te 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and, having bowed to the Blessed One, made this request:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag sngon grong khyer du bsod snyoms la mchis pa'i shul logs su mi grangs khri stong snyed mchis te /
analyzed: bdag sngon grong khyer du bsod snyoms la mchis pa'i shul logs su mi grangs khri stong snyed mchis te /
translated: I was once out begging for alms in the city when I saw in the distance ten thousand people.

original: de dag gi mgo bo ni ri bzhin du che /
analyzed: de dag gi mgo bo ni ri bzhin du che /
translated: Their heads were as big as mountains,

original: khog pa ni ri rab lhun po tsam 'dra /
analyzed: khog pa ni ri rab lhun po tsam 'dra /
translated: their bodies as large as Mount Sumeru,

original: mgrin pa ni khab bzhin du phra /
analyzed: mgrin pa ni khab bzhin du phra /
translated: and their throats as thin as needles.

original: phan tshun bskyod cing mchi ba na shing rta lnga brgya shin tu 'khrol ba'i sgra byung ste /
analyzed: phan tshun bskyod cing mchi ba na shing rta lnga brgya shin tu 'khrol ba'i sgra byung ste /
translated: As they moved about, the sound of five hundred carts being dragged along was heard.üîΩMoreover, a terrible stench of burning smoke arose from them.

original: de'ang mi bzad pa'i gzhob kyi dud pa kun nas 'thul lo; ;de ci'i dngos po lags pa dang / ci las gyur pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal du gsol /
analyzed: de'ang mi bzad pa'i gzhob kyi dud pa kun nas 'thul lo; ;de ci'i dngos po lags pa dang / ci las gyur pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal du gsol /
translated: What was the cause of this, and what did they do to deserve it?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das gyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das gyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: ‚ÄúMaudgalyƒÅyana,

original: de dag ni 'dre bkren ltogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'dre bkren ltogs pa yin te /
translated: they were starving spirits.

original: sngon 'das pa'i dus na mchod sdong bshig pa dang / mchod ston sbyar ba bshig pas de lta bu'i sdig pa rnam par smin pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon 'das pa'i dus na mchod sdong bshig pa dang / mchod ston sbyar ba bshig pas de lta bu'i sdig pa rnam par smin pa yin no //
translated: In the past they destroyed st≈´pas and destroyed offerings made to the sa·πÖgha. This is the ripening of such evil deeds.‚Äù

original: yang gcig tu na gzhan gyi mchod ston zos nas za gcig par ma byas pa'i sdig gi rnam par smin pa de yin no //
analyzed: yang gcig tu na gzhan gyi mchod ston zos nas za gcig par ma byas pa'i sdig gi rnam par smin pa de yin no //
translated: Or else, it is the ripening of the evil of not fasting after eating the food of others.

original: mchod ston lhag ma za gcig par mi byed pa la ma byin cig /üîΩyon bdag @145b gis lhag ma rnams dge 'dun la spags pa'i gsol ba byos la bzod par gsol cig /
analyzed: mchod ston lhag ma za gcig par mi byed pa la ma byin cig / yon bdag @145b gis lhag ma rnams dge 'dun la spags pa'i gsol ba byos la bzod par gsol cig /
translated: Do not eat the leftovers of the feast without fasting.üîΩThe host should ask the Sa·πÖgha to forgive him for the leftovers.

original: spags pa'i zas rnams dge 'dun rnams kyis gnang ba byin cig /
analyzed: spags pa'i zas rnams dge 'dun rnams kyis gnang ba byin cig /
translated: The Sa·πÖgha should give permission to eat the leftovers.

original: gnang ba ma byin na dge 'dun rnams kyang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnang ba ma byin na dge 'dun rnams kyang ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do not give permission, the Sa·πÖgha will be at fault.

original: de nas moonggal gyi bus gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas moonggal gyi bus gsol pa /
translated: Then MaudgalyƒÅyana said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ni yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ni yang dag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe Blessed One‚Äôs words are true.

original: yon bdag su'ang rung ste chos bzhin du bsdu ba'o phyir mchod pa'i yo byad 'byor tshogs te /
analyzed: yon bdag su'ang rung ste chos bzhin du bsdu ba'o phyir mchod pa'i yo byad 'byor tshogs te /
translated: Any host who has gathered the requisites for worship in accordance with the Dharma

original: zas gcig par byas pa rnams ni zas kyi 'tsho ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas gcig par byas pa rnams ni zas kyi 'tsho ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: will, by fasting, come to have a livelihood of food.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,üîΩ‚ÄúGood, good, MaudgalyƒÅyana!

original: za gcig par ma byas pa rnams ni zas dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: za gcig par ma byas pa rnams ni zas dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not fast will be deprived of food.

original: de ltar na nyi ma gcig za gcig pa thub na nyi ma drug khrir bsod nams dang / bza' ba rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na nyi ma gcig za gcig pa thub na nyi ma drug khrir bsod nams dang / bza' ba rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one fasts for one day, one will have merit and food for sixty thousand days.

original: de la de ltar ma byas pa rnams ni nyi ma khri khrag drug cur 'dre ltogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la de ltar ma byas pa rnams ni nyi ma khri khrag drug cur 'dre ltogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not do this will be hungry ghosts for sixty thousand days.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de'i sbyin pa ni shin tu lci ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i sbyin pa ni shin tu lci ba yin te /
translated: Because their generosity is very heavy.

original: gnyis na lcags kyi thu lum zos kyang sla yi /
analyzed: gnyis na lcags kyi thu lum zos kyang sla yi /
translated: It is easier to eat a lump of ironüîΩthan the food of faithful benefactors.

original: yon bdag dad pa can gyi zas ni shin tu bzhu bar dka' ste /
analyzed: yon bdag dad pa can gyi zas ni shin tu bzhu bar dka' ste /
translated: It is very difficult to digest.

original: shin tu yun ring por sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shin tu yun ring por sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te /
translated: For a very long time, one will suffer.

original: tshe rabs khri phrag brgyar 'dre ltogs pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe rabs khri phrag brgyar 'dre ltogs pa'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
translated: For a hundred thousand lifetimes, one will be a hungry ghost.

original: bsod nams kyi zas bya'o cog la nan tan cher byos shig /üîΩsnam phrag gam /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi zas bya'o cog la nan tan cher byos shig / snam phrag gam /
translated: Strive in all ways to make meritorious food.üîΩIf one carries it in one‚Äôs lap

original: phu rung gi nang du khyer bar byas na tshe rabs lnga brgyar dmyal bar ltung ste /
analyzed: phu rung gi nang du khyer bar byas na tshe rabs lnga brgyar dmyal bar ltung ste /
translated: or in one‚Äôs upper robe, one will fall into hell for five hundred lifetimes.

original: lcags kyi thu lum dmar po mchan khung g-yon @146a *//
analyzed: lcags kyi thu lum dmar po mchan khung g-yon @146a *//
translated: A red-hot iron ball will pass from his left armpit to his right,

original: pa nas thal te mchan khung g-yas par thal lo //
analyzed: pa nas thal te mchan khung g-yas par thal lo //
translated: and from his right armpit to his left.

original: lhag ma mi bkur bar byos shig /
analyzed: lhag ma mi bkur bar byos shig /
translated: The rest of the food should not be treated with contempt.

original: chung du na khre'i 'bru gcig tsam khyer na'ang lcags kyi 'khor lo tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chung du na khre'i 'bru gcig tsam khyer na'ang lcags kyi 'khor lo tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one takes as little as a single grain of millet, it will become as large as an iron wheel.

original: dge bsnyen gyis kyang rung ste bsod nams kyi zas sbyar ro cog la thog ma nas myang ba'i spags pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen gyis kyang rung ste bsod nams kyi zas sbyar ro cog la thog ma nas myang ba'i spags pa mi bya'o //
translated: Even an upƒÅsaka should not taste any food that is offered for the sake of merit.

original: de myangs bas sbyar ba thams cad lhag ma'i spags pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: de myangs bas sbyar ba thams cad lhag ma'i spags pa mi bya'o //
translated: If he tastes it, he should not treat the remainder with contempt.

original: byas pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does so, it will be meaningless.

original: gnyis na ma byas kyang sla'o //
analyzed: gnyis na ma byas kyang sla'o //
translated: If he does not do so, it is all right.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: lha thams cad mi 'gyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha thams cad mi 'gyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: All the gods will not be pleased.

original: gnyen po thams cad mi dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyen po thams cad mi dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All the relatives will be unhappy.

original: gang zhig myangs pa zhig yod na tshe rabs lnga khrir 'dre ltogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig myangs pa zhig yod na tshe rabs lnga khrir 'dre ltogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he tastes it, he will be a hungry ghost for fifty thousand lifetimes.

original: sdug bsngal mi bzad pa sna tshogs kyang myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi bzad pa sna tshogs kyang myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will also experience various unbearable sufferings.

original: gang zhig phyin chad bsod nams 'dod pas tshul bzhin du bsod nams kyi zas gtsang spras phyed pa dang / shin tu gus par sbyar la lag pa shin tu dag par bkrus nas tshod ma la sogs pa drod bag tu sbyar ro cog shig tu bkab pa dang /
analyzed: gang zhig phyin chad bsod nams 'dod pas tshul bzhin du bsod nams kyi zas gtsang spras phyed pa dang / shin tu gus par sbyar la lag pa shin tu dag par bkrus nas tshod ma la sogs pa drod bag tu sbyar ro cog shig tu bkab pa dang /
translated: Whoever, desiring merit in the future, properly prepares pure food and drink, and with great respect and with very clean hands, covers with a cloth all the warm foods such as vegetables,

original: rim gro bskyed de de dag kyang sngar myang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rim gro bskyed de de dag kyang sngar myang bar mi bya'o //
translated: and serves them with respect, and does not taste them beforehand,

original: de nas bsod nams su gyur cing lha thams cad kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bsod nams su gyur cing lha thams cad kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it becomes merit and all the gods will be pleased.

original: gnyen po thams cad kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyen po thams cad kyang dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All the relatives will be pleased.

original: lha la sogs pa thams cad kyis srung zhing byin gyis rlob par 'gyur te yang dag par smra ba yin no //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa thams cad kyis srung zhing byin gyis rlob par 'gyur te yang dag par smra ba yin no //
translated: All the gods and so forth will protect and bless him, and he will be a true speaker.

original: bsod nams rnam par smin pa ni brag ca dang / gzugs brnyan @146b bzhin no //
analyzed: bsod nams rnam par smin pa ni brag ca dang / gzugs brnyan @146b bzhin no //
translated: The ripening of merit is like an echo and a reflection.

original: de ltar 'dre bkren ltogs pa ni thog ma mi las gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dre bkren ltogs pa ni thog ma mi las gyur te /
translated: Thus, the hungry ghost was originally a human being.

original: thog ma lag pa mi gtsang bas dge 'dun gyi kha zas gtsang ma la reg pa dang / bdag gi lag pa mi gtsang bas dge 'dun gyi kha zas gtsang ma'i nang du bsngogs sam /
analyzed: thog ma lag pa mi gtsang bas dge 'dun gyi kha zas gtsang ma la reg pa dang / bdag gi lag pa mi gtsang bas dge 'dun gyi kha zas gtsang ma'i nang du bsngogs sam /
translated: First, with his impure hands he touched the pure food of the Sangha, and with his impure hands he stirred the pure food of the Sangha.

original: zas gtsang ma'i nang du kha zas mi gtsang ba bsres te dge 'dun la sbyin pa byas pas tshe rabs lnga brgyar 'dre logs par ltung ste /
analyzed: zas gtsang ma'i nang du kha zas mi gtsang ba bsres te dge 'dun la sbyin pa byas pas tshe rabs lnga brgyar 'dre logs par ltung ste /
translated: Or he mixed impure food with the pure food and gave it to the Sangha. For five hundred lifetimes he fell into the ghost realm.

original: rtag tu mi gtsang ba za zhing snam phyi sar mi gtsang ba za na /
analyzed: rtag tu mi gtsang ba za zhing snam phyi sar mi gtsang ba za na /
translated: He always ate impure things, and ate the feces and urine of children.

original: snam byis pa'i srung mas lcags kyi ber ka sa gdengs te 'dre logs pa de rnams phyi sa'i sar mi snyan par byed do //
analyzed: snam byis pa'i srung mas lcags kyi ber ka sa gdengs te 'dre logs pa de rnams phyi sa'i sar mi snyan par byed do //
translated: The guardian of the children of the village raised an iron staff and drove the ghosts away from the place of feces and urine.

original: mi'i rnag dang / khrag dang mchil snabs dang / ngar snabs dang / khrud ma mi gtsang ba btsog pa za zhing mi gtsang ba srung zhing bud med bu btsas pa'i khrag mi gtsang ba 'dzag pa za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi'i rnag dang / khrag dang mchil snabs dang / ngar snabs dang / khrud ma mi gtsang ba btsog pa za zhing mi gtsang ba srung zhing bud med bu btsas pa'i khrag mi gtsang ba 'dzag pa za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He ate the impure filth of human pus, blood, saliva, mucus, and excrement. He ate the impure blood that flowed from a woman‚Äôs vagina after she gave birth.

original: de nas tshe rabs khri phrag lnga brgyar khyi dang / phag pa dang / spur ba la sogs pa'i lus su gyur nas rtag par mnam zhing btseg pa dang / mi gtsang ba za bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas tshe rabs khri phrag lnga brgyar khyi dang / phag pa dang / spur ba la sogs pa'i lus su gyur nas rtag par mnam zhing btseg pa dang / mi gtsang ba za bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then for five hundred thousand lifetimes he will be born with the body of a dog, pig, or fox, and will always be stinking, dirty, and eating filth.

original: de lta bu'i sdug bsngal bskal pa grangs khri stong du myong ste thar ba'i dus med do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sdug bsngal bskal pa grangs khri stong du myong ste thar ba'i dus med do //
translated: He will experience such suffering for many thousands of eons, and will have no chance of liberation.üîΩIt is difficult to be liberated.

original: rnam par thar bar dka'o //üîΩshin tu mi zad pa'ang brjod kyi mi lang ngo //üîΩgal te lag pa pho mtshan la reg gam /üîΩlag pa mo mtshan la reg gam /
analyzed: rnam par thar bar dka'o // shin tu mi zad pa'ang brjod kyi mi lang ngo // gal te lag pa pho mtshan la reg gam / lag pa mo mtshan la reg gam /
translated: It is difficult to be liberated.üîΩIt is difficult to be liberated.üîΩIt is difficult to be liberated.üîΩIt is difficult to be liberated.

original: lag pa mi gtsang bas dge 'dun gyi kha zas gtsang ma la reg gam /üîΩdge 'dun gyi kha zas la mi gtsang ba nang du bcug gam /
analyzed: lag pa mi gtsang bas dge 'dun gyi kha zas gtsang ma la reg gam / dge 'dun gyi kha zas la mi gtsang ba nang du bcug gam /
translated: It is difficult to be liberated.üîΩIt is difficult to be liberated.

original: mi gtsang ba'i zas dge 'dun zar bcug @147a *//üîΩna de lta bu'i sdig pa rnam par smin pa ni thams cad mi gnad kyi rims kyis btab pa dang / sdig par mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i zas dge 'dun zar bcug @147a *//üîΩna de lta bu'i sdig pa rnam par smin pa ni thams cad mi gnad kyi rims kyis btab pa dang / sdig par mi shes pa'o //

original: phyin chad dge 'dun gyi kha zas gtsang bar byas pa dang / lag pa gtsang mas dge 'dun gyi kha zas kyi snod la bzung ba dang / lag pa gtsang mas khre 'bras bkru ba dang / kha zas gtsang ma sbyin pa byas pa ni bsod nams bsam gyis mi khyab pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyin chad dge 'dun gyi kha zas gtsang bar byas pa dang / lag pa gtsang mas dge 'dun gyi kha zas kyi snod la bzung ba dang / lag pa gtsang mas khre 'bras bkru ba dang / kha zas gtsang ma sbyin pa byas pa ni bsod nams bsam gyis mi khyab pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: From now on, if you make the food of the Sa·πÖgha clean, if you hold the vessel of the Sa·πÖgha‚Äôs food with clean hands, if you wash the rice and grain with clean hands, and if you give clean food, you will obtain inconceivable merit.

original: phyin chad 'di yongs su grags pa dang / myur bu'i yid kyis zungs shig /
analyzed: phyin chad 'di yongs su grags pa dang / myur bu'i yid kyis zungs shig /
translated: From now on, you should remember this with a quick mind.

original: 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa'i mdo rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa'i mdo rdzogs so ////
translated: The S≈´tra on Pure Livelihood is complete.
